Issues.Title: WPF Crash on modern Touchscreen when EnablePointerSupport is enabled
Issues.Body:
### Description

On a Surface Pro 9 my WPF app crashes when clicking anything. 

This seems to be caused by enabling Switch.System.Windows.Input.Stylus.EnablePointerSupport

I have attached an example repo

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/20043350/56275e3a-b16c-4260-9430-07f11e801b0b)

This was recommend by CefSharp in there Example 
See here:
https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp/blob/master/CefSharp.Wpf.Example/App.xaml.cs

Issues.Title: WPF crash while RDP login 0x88980803
Issues.Body:
### Description

发生异常: CLR/System.ArgumentException
“System.ArgumentException”类型的未经处理的异常在 System.Private.CoreLib.dll 中发生 : '后台缓冲区的设备无效。'
 发现内部异常，有关更多详细信息，请参阅变量窗口中的 $exception。
 最里面的异常 	 System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException : 0x88980803

### Reproduction Steps

- run a wpf in pc-A
- login RDP using pc-B
- WPF APP crash

OK

### Actual behavior

Issues.Title: StackOverflowException while using DataTemplate for String data type in ItemsControl
Issues.Body:
### Description

Hello! I have a WPF application with ItemsControl. It's ItemsSource property is set to ObservableCollection<T>, and I checked different data types as T. ItemsControl has a Resources section where I tried defining templates for different data types. The issue appears when I set a DataTemplate for string data type and when ObservableCollection has at least one string element. When that happens the program crashes with StackOverflowException. So far I haven't noticed such an issue with any other data type.

### Reproduction Steps

I've created a fresh WPF project to check if the issue is reproducible. Here is the code which gives the exception:

_MainWindow.xaml_
```csharp
<Window x:Class="TestItemsControlBug.MainWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:sys="clr-namespace:System;assembly=mscorlib"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Title="MainWindow" Height="450" Width="800">
    <ItemsControl ItemsSource="{Binding Values}">
        <ItemsControl.Resources>
            <DataTemplate DataType="{x:Type sys:String}">
                <Button Content="+"/>
            </DataTemplate>
        </ItemsControl.Resources>
    </ItemsControl>
</Window>
```

_MainWindow.xaml.cs_
```csharp
using System.Windows;

namespace TestItemsControlBug
{
    /// <summary>
    /// Interaction logic for MainWindow.xaml
    /// </summary>
    public partial class MainWindow : Window
    {
        public MainWindow()
        {
            InitializeComponent();
            DataContext = new ViewModel();
        }
    }
}
```

_ViewModel.cs_
```csharp
using System.Collections.ObjectModel;

namespace TestItemsControlBug
{
    public class ViewModel
    {
        public ObservableCollection<string> Values { get; } = new() { "test" };
    }
}
```

### Expected behavior

Show window with a button.

### Actual behavior

1) System.StackOverflowException
  HResult=0x800703E9
  Message=Exception_WasThrown

### Regression?

### Known Workarounds

Not using strings :)

Issues.Title: Use ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ThrowIf* to replace custom error messages
Issues.Body:
This is a followup to #8403.

## Description

Many error messages can be replaced with messages from the BCL using the new `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` throw helpers.
Here are the messages I removed, each in its own commit:

- ParameterMustBeGreaterThanZero
- ParameterCannotBeNegative
- ParameterCannotBeGreaterThan
- ParameterCannotBeLessThan
- ParameterValueMustBeGreaterThanZero
- ParameterValueCannotBeNegative
- ShouldBeZero

ParameterMustBeBetween would be a good candidate, but this would slightly change the information conveyed by the error message. I still think it's worth it though.
ParameterValueCannotBeInfinity and ParameterValueCannotBeNaN also come to mind.

## Customer Impact

Slight performance improvement, and a bit fewer resources.

## Regression

No

## Testing

CI

## Risk

Low. I manually searched and removed the error messages, and let CA1512 finish the work
